result.execSummary:
The defendant John H Pharm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John H Pharm in court.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

The defendant was just released from jail.  He served his condition time but the agent does not have any updates for the court, therefore, the review date has been adjourned to 03/18/2016 at 01:30 p..m.
cab
Corrected to add 7 days of credit for time served.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing 
  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel, the defendant. Additional statements made by:  Jennifer L. and A.P.
As to count 1:
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive, with credit for 7 days time served.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge.
- Defendant to pay all other fees, surgcharges and assessments.
.
As to counts 2 and 3:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, as to count 2, consecutive,  and as to count 3 the defendant was sentenced to 3 months, consecutive to each other and to count 1.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other and to the sentence on count 1,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
-  Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  May have contact for any family court proceedings.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AS CHARGED, 1 AS AMENDED, AND 3 AS ADDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defendant advised he must comply with all conditions of bail. Court VACATED Jury Trial date of 6/29/2015.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial Conference. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 Amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
STATED ADDED COUNT 3
Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Final Pretrial date. Court granted defense request. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 6/29/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel recently appointed. Court set matter for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for Molly Schmidt for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel. Court GRATED and case set for a Status of Counsel date. Case adjourned in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Stephen Pugeli.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cynithia P. or ALP dob 8/20/02

Defendant John H Pharm in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant John H Pharm in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
